alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 12:17PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .San Lorenzo River at Big Trees is currently in minor flood stage. Flooding is ongoing near the San Lorenzo River at Big Trees. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to Ongoing flooding along the San Lorenzo River. . Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in San Lorenzo River at Big Trees. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Cruz and Felton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
